confession.seduction_context: out gathering raspberries with her mother
sabbat_activities: dancing to sound of oboe, flute, and drum

testimony.quarrel_subject: Sebille spoke ill of Jean Mourisot's wife before other women

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: soon after she helped winnowing millet

testimony.quarrel_subject: confession to cleric that she was a witch became known; wife told neighbors
testimony.threat_quote: Sebille threatened his wife after she told neighbors about the confession

testimony.quarrel_subject: Nicolas Maurice told his wife he didn't want Sebille coming to his house to learn to read because she was a witch

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: shortly after he refused to teach her; died in 3 days

testimony.quarrel_subject: saw Sebille embracing a young man and told of this in village

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: fell very ill for 14 weeks after telling village

testimony.quarrel_subject: his young sister Claudette's oxen damaged field belonging to Sebille's father; Sebille beat her severely

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: died within a week after complaining of her legs
after father reproached Sebille for being promiscuous

testimony.quarrel_subject: did not invite Sebille to be godmother or even present at birth due to her evil reputation for witchcraft and sexual promiscuity

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: immediately after Sebille made angry gesture; illness lasted a year

timeline.subject: Sebille fille Didier Pescheur
timeline.details: Witness testimony collected; Sebille arrested after 10+ years absence

timeline.subject: Sebille fille Didier Pescheur
timeline.details: Confronted with witnesses; no reproaches or admissions; waved finger angrily at Jean Morisot

timeline.subject: Sebille fille Didier Pescheur
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves question ordinaire et extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Sebille fille Didier Pescheur
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture; confessed after thumbscrews, rack, and tortillons

timeline.subject: Sebille fille Didier Pescheur
timeline.details: Interviewed twice, confirmed confessions; wept bitterly and asked for mercy and confessor

timeline.subject: Sebille fille Didier Pescheur
timeline.details: Final sentence read in her presence

prior_accusations.context: mother executed as witch; general reputation mentions mother accused her

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Mourisot (witness)
notable_quotes.french: sy on vouloit bien faire on la debvoit apprehender pour luy faire et parfaire son proces
notable_quotes.english: if one wanted to do right, she should be apprehended to have her trial completed
notable_quotes.context: cleric told him Sebille confessed to being a witch

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Mourisot's wife
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle estoit frappée a mort et que cela provenoit des sortileges de ladite prevenue
notable_quotes.english: that she was struck to death and that this came from the witchcraft of the said accused

notable_quotes.speaker: Didier Pescheur (father)
notable_quotes.french: qu'il s'en doutoit aucunement, et que sa mere cy devant executée l'avoit ja trompé de la sorte
notable_quotes.english: that he suspected as much, and that her mother executed before had already deceived him in the same manner
notable_quotes.context: when Jean Mourisot told him of suspicions about his daughter

notable_quotes.speaker: Sebille Pescheur (accused)
notable_quotes.context: threat to Nicolas Maurice after he refused to teach her to read

notable_quotes.speaker: Sebille Pescheur (witness 11 reports)
notable_quotes.french: que c'estoit bien peu de cas, qu'elle avoit heu tousjours cela en passant
notable_quotes.english: that it was very little matter, that she had always had that in passing
notable_quotes.context: commenting on death of Fleurette while working in fields

notable_quotes.speaker: Sebille Pescheur (accused)
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle ne s'en mette pas en peine qu'elle n'en mourroit mais qu'elle avoit du mal assez
notable_quotes.english: that she should not worry about it, that she would not die but that she had enough pain
notable_quotes.context: to Jehenne Barbier's sister who feared having to feed the baby

notable_quotes.speaker: Sebille Pescheur (accused)
notable_quotes.french: que quant il plaira a dieu elle est preste d'endurer la mort, suppliantz qu'on luy soit doulx et misericordieux, et luy envoyer un bon confesseur (en pleurant tres amerement)
notable_quotes.english: that when it pleases God she is ready to endure death, begging that they be gentle and merciful to her, and send her a good confessor (weeping very bitterly)

relationships.evidence_text: Sebille daughter of the late Didier Pescheur
Jean Morisot's wife had been her sister

economic_context.details: Quarrel over oxen damaging field belonging to Sebille's father led to beating of Claudette. Sebille's reputation for sexual promiscuity ('luxure et paillardise') and poverty evident in her service work.

harms_catalog.harm_description: fell ill immediately after eating millet given by Sebille, died within a week
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: spoke ill of her before other women; wife told neighbors about confession to cleric

harms_catalog.harm_description: fell backwards after second spoonful of millet, died
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: wife told neighbors about Sebille's confession to cleric; Sebille threatened her

harms_catalog.harm_description: fell ill suddenly and died in 3 days
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: told his wife he didn't want Sebille coming to house to learn to read because she was a witch who killed Morisot's wife

harms_catalog.harm_description: fell very ill for 14 weeks, unable to eat or rest
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: saw her embracing a young man and told of this in village
harms_catalog.method_alleged: yellow powder placed where he would pass; later cured with white powder in cooked fish

harms_catalog.harm_description: complained of her legs, died within a week
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: oxen did damage in field belonging to Sebille's father; Sebille beat Claudette severely
father reproached Sebille for being promiscuous and involved with young men

harms_catalog.harm_description: milk stopped after giving birth, thought she would die
illness lasting a year; difficulty breastfeeding, milk became yellow, child too; thought both would die
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: did not invite Sebille to be godmother or present at birth due to reputation for witchcraft and promiscuity
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: immediately after Sebille made angry gesture
harms_catalog.method_alleged: later sent soup that began recovery

material_culture.context: Jean Mourisot's wife helped Sebille winnowing millet, took some home, cooked and ate it, then died
Jean Bandeca obtained cooked fish from Sebille which cured his illness
Sebille sent soup to Jehenne Barbier which restored her appetite
Sebille came to sprinkle holy water on body of Claudette after death
Jean Bandeca threatened to attack Sebille with an axe
Sebille often came to Jean Mourisot's house to ask for milk
Sebille found a cloth under which she made her way to Epinal when fleeing
Sebille was gathering raspberries with her mother when seduced by devil
tried powder on a hen; gave master 4 or 5 hens a year to be dispensed from sabbat
devil gave three kinds of powder: black to kill, yellow to make languish, white to cure
musical instruments played by devils at sabbat
all participants at sabbat were masked

spatial_references.context: primary location of trial; where Sebille lived until age 27
Sebille lived here for 6 months after leaving la Neufville
Sebille worked in service here; served as 'tante' for a curé; fled here to hide
Sebille slept outside gate/door of this village on night of escape
home of Fleurette fille Jean Musnier
where criminal proceedings were publicly read
Sebille hid in river up to her neck when authorities tried to arrest her
field belonging to Sebille's father damaged by oxen; women working in fields
specific spot at Côte de Repy where sabbat was held

economic_hardship_indicators: Sebille worked as servant in multiple locations
came to house to ask for milk
devil promised they would never want

hearsay_chains.content: believed Sebille caused her milk to stop after giving birth because not invited to be godmother
Sebille made confession to cleric that she was a witch

emotional_state_notes: waved finger angrily at Jean Morisot during confrontation
closed eyes and 'quasi comme en extase' during torture
wept very bitterly (pleurant tres amerement) during final interrogation

third_parties.name: Didier Pescheur (father)
third_parties.context: told Jean Mourisot he suspected his daughter; said her mother had deceived him the same way

third_parties.name: mother (executed as witch)
third_parties.context: executed as witch; accused Sebille; was with Sebille gathering raspberries when devil seduced her

third_parties.name: wife of Nicolas Maurice
third_parties.context: Nicolas Maurice told his wife he didn't want Sebille coming to house

third_parties.name: Nicolas Maurice
third_parties.context: teaching Sebille to read; refused to continue; died in 3 days after Sebille's threat

third_parties.name: regular cleric at convent
third_parties.context: Sebille allegedly confessed to him that she was a witch; did not absolve her

third_parties.name: Jehenne Badelle
third_parties.context: believed Sebille caused her milk to stop after giving birth because not invited to be godmother

third_parties.name: Fleurette fille Jean Musnier
third_parties.context: death discussed by women working in fields; Sebille commented dismissively

third_parties.name: Claudette (sister of Chrestien Brabant)
third_parties.context: keeping oxen that damaged field; beaten by Sebille; died within a week

third_parties.name: father of Chrestien Brabant
third_parties.context: reproached Sebille for being promiscuous; suspected dead from her witchcraft

third_parties.name: sister of Jehenne Barbier
third_parties.context: complained might have to feed Jehenne's child; Sebille told her not to worry

third_parties.name: curé at Epinal
third_parties.context: Sebille served as 'tante' (housekeeper) for this priest

third_parties.name: young man
third_parties.context: Jean Bandeca saw Sebille embracing a young man

extraction_metadata.notes: This is a detailed trial record with substantial witness testimony. Key features: (1) Sebille fled for 10+ years before being arrested - unusual case of someone evading justice for extended period. (2) Her mother was executed as witch and allegedly accused her. (3) Strong reputation evidence spanning up to 29 years. (4) Confession includes interesting detail about trying to resist devil by throwing away powders and making sign of cross. (5) Pattern of harms related to quarrels over gossip, sexual reputation, and social slights (not being invited as godmother). (6) Healing element: used white powder to cure Jean Bandeca after making him ill. (7) Economic status indicators: worked as servant, asked for charity, reputation for sexual promiscuity. (8) Geographic mobility: worked in multiple towns (Donipaire, Mirecourt, Epinal). (9) Cleric's role interesting - allegedly heard her confession of witchcraft but did not absolve her. (10) Father's comment that mother had 'deceived him the same way' suggests family pattern. Sebille denied accusations during initial interrogation but confessed under torture. Witness 2 (Jean Mourisot) appears to be formal accuser though not explicitly identified as partie formelle.
